display

Class TestScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas
        • display.Screen
          • display.TestScreen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget, test.TestWrapper

    public class TestScreen
extends Screen
implements test.TestWrapper
    The TestScreen class combines functionality of a Screen and a Test. A TestScreen instance shows and animates a Creature given. The class contains methods to control a Test while simultaneously rendering it on a Screen.

    This class is able to:

    • test (animate) a single Creature given, repeating
    • test multiple Creature instances in succession
    • enable or disable information about the creature displayed on the screen
    • start/pause the animation
    • fast forward/slo-mo
    • reset the play-back speed
    • enable/disable the camera locking to the Creature
    • reset camera

    The play-back speed is limited to max = 1024 and min = 0.01 times the normal speed.

    This class can be handed over to a PlayBackControls class for direct user interaction with the TestScreen.

    NOTE: The refresh() method has to be called every frame to run the Test and animation.

    • Field Detail

      • test

        private test.Test test
        Main Test instance, calculates Box2D physics of a Creature.

      • playBackSpeed

        private float playBackSpeed
        playBackSpeed represents how many "Test-seconds" are shown in one second. It is limited to maxPlayBackSpeed = 1024 and minPlayBackSpeed = 0.01 times the normal speed.

      • maxPlayBackSpeed

        private static float maxPlayBackSpeed
        maxPlayBackSpeed specifies the maximum fast forwarding speed

      • minPlayBackSpeed

        private static float minPlayBackSpeed
        minPlayBackSpeed specifies the minimum slow motion speed

    • Constructor Detail

      • TestScreen

        public TestScreen(double resX,
                  double resY,
                  float scale_in,
                  org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 pos_in,
                  population.Population pop_in)
        Initialises a new TestScreen instance. The screen is set up with resX and resY as resolution. The initial B2DCamera framing will be set by scale and a Vec2 pos_in. This class also needs a reference to the main Population to get Creature instances for rendering.

        With default settings the camera will follow a Creature in the x-direction. More information for the scale and a pos_in parameters click B2DCamera.

        Parameters:
        resX - amount of horizontal pixels
        resY - amount of vertical pixels
        scale_in - zoom of the B2DCamera
        pos_in - (Box2D world) position of the B2DCamera
        pop_in - reference to the main Population

      • TestScreen

        public TestScreen(double resX,
                  double resY,
                  float scale_in,
                  org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 pos_in)
        Initialises a new TestScreen instance without a Population reference. The screen is set up with resX and resY as resolution. The initial B2DCamera framing will be set by scale and a Vec2 pos_in.

        NOTE: Using this constructor will disable some functionality involving the main Population.

        With default settings the camera will follow a Creature in the x-direction. More information for the scale and a pos_in parameters click B2DCamera.

        Parameters:
        resX - amount of horizontal pixels
        resY - amount of vertical pixels
        scale_in - zoom of the B2DCamera
        pos_in - (Box2D world) position of the B2DCamera

    • Method Detail

      • startSingleTest

        public void startSingleTest(population.Creature creature)
        Starts a Test with the Creature referenced. The test will set set the fitness of the Creature once it's done. If enableAutoRepeat had been called, the test will automatically reset and start again, if not the test will continue to run until a new Creature is set with this method.

        User interaction such as play/pause or fast-forward/slo-mo is considered during the test.

        Parameters:
        creature - is tested by this TestScreen

      • refresh

        public void refresh(float dt)
        Draws the Test to the TestScreen. This method has to be called every frame to run the calculation of the animation / physics calculations.
        Parameters:
        dt - delta time: time (in seconds) since last frame

      • playPause

        public void playPause()
        Toggles the Test. If it was running, it will be paused and the other way around.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops/pauses the animation / physics calculations of this TestScreen instance.

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the animation / physics calculations of this TestScreen instance.

      • fast

        public void fast()
        Doubles the speed of the animation / physics calculations of this TestScreen instance. This doesn't affect the result itself, it is only being played faster.

        The maximum speed is defined by the constant maxPlayBackSpeed = 1024

      • slow

        public void slow()
        Halves the speed of the animation / physics calculations of this TestScreen instance. This doesn't affect the result itself, it is only being played slower.

        The minimum speed is defined by the constant minPlayBackSpeed = 0.01

      • resetSpeed

        public void resetSpeed()
        Resets the speed of the animation / physics calculations of this TestScreen instance to 1.

      • toggleView

        public void toggleView()
        Enables/disables the camera follow feature of the internal B2DCamera. If enabled this will make the view follow the Creature. The user cannot manipulate the framing in the x-direction.

      • testOneByOne

        public void testOneByOne()
        Tests every Creature in the referenced Population which hasn't been tested yet. Once all Creatures are tested, this TestScreen will reset itself.

      • showMuscles

        public void showMuscles(boolean show)
        Calling this method will enable/disable the muscles of the active Creature. It also shows their activity.
        Parameters:
        show - true shows muscle

      • showMuscles

        public void showMuscles()
        Calling this method will toggle the display of muscles of the active Creature.

      • musclesEnabled

        public boolean musclesEnabled()
        Returns true if the muscles are being rendered
        Returns:
        muscles are enabled

      • isTestRunning

        public boolean isTestRunning()
        Returns true if the the TestScreen is currently running. If it is paused or no Creature is set, it returns false
        Returns:
        false if TestScreen is paused

      • taskDone

        public void taskDone(population.Creature creature_in,
                     float calcFitness)
        Description copied from interface: test.TestWrapper
        The taskDone() method is called immediately after the Test has evaluated a fitness for the tested Creature. It provides the referenced Creature and the new calculated fitness value. The fitness is not applied to the Creature; this has to be done manually.
        Specified by:
        taskDone in interface test.TestWrapper
        Parameters:
        creature_in - Reference to the tested Creature
        calcFitness - Calculated fitness value for the Creature, NOT (yet) applied!

      • pauseDone

        public void pauseDone(population.Creature creature_in,
                      float newFitness)
        Description copied from interface: test.TestWrapper
        The pauseDone() method is called a defined time (Test.afterTestLength) after the Test has evaluated a fitness for the tested Creature. It provides the referenced Creature and the new calculated fitness value. The fitness is not applied to the Creature; this has to be done manually.
        Specified by:
        pauseDone in interface test.TestWrapper
        Parameters:
        creature_in - Reference to the tested Creature
        newFitness - Calculated fitness value for the Creature, NOT (yet) applied!

      • setInfoString

        public void setInfoString()
        Creates a String based on the data form the current generation an Creature and passes it directly (via String infoText to the draw function.

        If infoEnabled(1) was called information for the current generation, creature ID and its fitness is added to toe string
        If infoEnabled(2) was called information only the creature ID and its fitness is added to the string

      • hasCreature

        public boolean hasCreature()
        Returns true if a Creature is currently set in the TestScreen
        Returns:
        has Creature in Test

      • enableAutoRepeat

        public void enableAutoRepeat()
        Calling this method will repeat test the same Creature again once the test is over.

      • disableAutoRepeat

        public void disableAutoRepeat()
        Calling this method disable automatic repetition of a test.

      • showScore

        public void showScore(boolean show)
        Calling this method will enable/disable a marker which marks the distance the active Creature is able to reach in the given time. If the fitness is not evaluated, the marker won't be shown.
        Parameters:
        show - shows the fitness on the x-axis

      • showTimer

        public void showTimer(boolean show)
        Calling this method will enable/disable a timer shown in the top right corner of the TestScreen it shows the elapsed time and the total time of the current Test
        Parameters:
        show - shows a timer

      • setFollowOffset

        public void setFollowOffset(org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 offset_in)
        Adjust the framing when following a Creature. This method takes a Vec2 vector and adds it to the camera position when locked.
        Parameters:
        offset_in - offset from creature centre

      • getCreatureID

        public int getCreatureID()
        Returns the ID of the Creature currently on the TestScreen.
        Returns:
        ID of active Creature

      • stepCallback

        public void stepCallback(int step)
        Specified by:
        stepCallback in interface test.TestWrapper
